Ok, quick update: 
Placement went really well this week I think. Both my host teachers are really great and it shows me two different teaching styles. My host teacher for history is a really fantastic teacher and kind of reminds me of my grade 10 science teacher crossed with my grade 11 religion teacher (my fave teacher ever). 

The main group I worked with was the grade 10 applied history. They're kind of a handful, but they're a pretty good group of kids. I taught a total of five classes, covering the 1920's then the Great Depression. Last friday I taught a lesson on the Persons case then divided them into two groups to argue in front of a mock supreme court. As I learned, it's a good idea in theory, but when you're working with applied kids, not so much. They didn't follow the rules I set out for them at all and it pretty much just turned into a shouting match between the two sides. Despite that, it at least seems like they learned something, I hope. 

Then on wednesday the teacher wanted to cover some stuff with them first, so I only got about fifteen minutes to teach my lesson, which ended up being just an overhead on the causes of the Depression. And listening to those kids complain about how long the overhead I made them was (it was one page!!) I told them they'd probably die if they saw some of the lecture notes I've taken. So I felt kind of guilty and promised them no more overheads.

Yesterday I taught a lesson on what life was like in the Great Depression. Again I was pressed for time so I just showed them some visuals and photos about life in the Great Depression then put on a video for them to answer questions. Then today I finally got to get through some of the stuff I had wanted to and gave them an assignment. The students have alot of energy, but they're nice kids. I was chatting with some of the girls in the class and one of them told me they think I'm a good teacher so far, which was kind of nice, but then a few more started asking me if I cut my hair and telling me it looked nice, so I got thinking they were just sucking up to get good marks, haha. 

Then yesterday something really interesting happened. After school this girl came by to talk to my host teacher. After she left, I got the whole story and it turned out she'd been kicked out of her home. The teacher spent an hour trying to sort out with one of her friends some arrangements where she'd have a place to stay and all that, and when she said she hadn't had anything to eat since the previous morning he gave her ten bucks of his own money to go buy something. So we had a big long discussion after they left, and he said he's definitely going to talk to a social worker and guidance. To sum up it was pretty eye opening about some of the other stuff teachers deal with. But that's what I really like about this teacher, he really cares about his students and wants them to do well. 

Oh and monday my host teacher invited me to the staff meeting, which was kind of interesting because they had a police officer come to talk to the teachers about lockdown procedures. It was scary stuff, but necessary. 

So that was my week. Must go to bed now.

I'm going to miss him :(

Since it was my last day my boss and everyone in my division took me out for lunch which was really nice of them. And I found out I can come back to the branch next summer - the director came by to say goodbye and explained it to me - typically students are only allowed to work two summers in the same branch, but my boss twisted some arms and human resources said I could come back but they have to go through the reinterviewing process etc. 

So I said goodbye to everyone which was kind of sad - I really like the people I work with and I think this is the only job I've ever had, aside from my library job, where I truly felt appreciated for the work I did. I also realy like my host teacher for english. 

Yesterday the teacher was talking to the class about what they'll be studying and he mentioned schizophrenia which got me thinking. I had a slight case of nerves which I think threw me a bit. Afterwards the teacher mentioned that he was given six special needs students in the class but just looking at them during today's lesson he can tell there are many more students with high needs so he suggested that tomorrow he give them some sort os excercise then afterwards he and I can look through them and determine who the at-risk students are and then pair them with other students who can help them and create a sort of buddy system. And grrr I think I'm getting sick again; the last two days I was so tired when I got home I just slept for about two hours. High school students take alot out of you!!
